location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter, William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, encloses a transmission of a dispatch to the Persian Secretary to the Supreme Government, dated 26 February. The dispatch, which is addressed to George Swinton, precedes this letter. In the dispatch, Bruce acknowledges the receipt of Supreme Government commands dated 25 November 1819, which stated that a carriage and harness for a pair of horses for Ibrahin Khaun [Ebrāhim Khan], Governor of Kermaun [Kermān], had been sent for despatch on board the Volunteership and addressed to Bruce's care. Bruce responds by stating that the items were landed at Bushire yesterday.
